name: Four Points by Sheraton Orlando Studio City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I give his hotel top marks!! My husband and I stayed here four 4 nights in early September. I read many positive reviews before travelling, and this hotel did not disappoint.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Sheraton!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was relatively simple. When we arrived at noon, our room wasn't ready, so we stored our bags and headed to IHop for lunch (just across the street). After we ate, we continued to wait by the pool where a hotel staff member came to find us to let know know when the room was ready. It wasn't too long of a wait at all.
reviews.title: Stayed Here AGAIN!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby of the hotel is inviting - large, bright, and clean. The right-hand side of the lobby hosts four or five computers with internet, a small bar, and a television.
reviews.title: brilliant hotel best we have had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very nice. Very large and spacious, as well as CLEAN! Beds were very comfortable as well. Free wifi in rooms. A little slow at times, but can't complain for free! Looks like this hotel may have been renovated recently - carpets are free of stains, bathroom very nice, etc. The only "complaint" I would have is the external cleanliness of the windows - it really hinders the beautiful view :o) But this, of course, only minor!
reviews.title: excellent hotel in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is superb! On International Drive, so in the hussle and bussle of everything! Ihop, Denny's, Red Lobster, 7 Eleven all within a few minute stroll. Wet and Wild is about a 5 minute walk, and Universal is about 5 minute cab ride (less than $10). The I-Trolley bus also stops just outside the hotel to bring you up and down International Drive. Great way to get around!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: This was the second time staying at this hotel, the first time I don't recall it being so disgusting... As a starwood preferred customer there are some perks or so you are told, but this time even though at the check in the hotel attendee seem very nice, they did not have a refrigerator available for us as I had requested over the phone. ( which by the way there's a $5- per day fee) the refrigerators are first come- first served but when I complained they compensated us by offering us two days of breakfast for two adults. The next day when we arrived back to our room we found what seemed to be a " refrigerator" it's very small but it served it's purpose. We stayed on the 16th floor overlooking island of adventure, indoor sky diving and wet n wild it was definitively nice, the only problem was that unfortunately, that was not enough for me to overlook how dirty the sheets in one of the beds were and how many small hairs I found in the bathroom tub before we even unloaded. Luckily, there were two beds and the one we slept on seem fine. B/c The ice machine on the 18th floor doesnt work , we ended up going to the 15th floor and we noticed they were remodeling those units. Overall, the price and location make up the disadvantages if you are on a budget. If i had to stay here again 6 months from now I would ask for a freshly remmodeled room on the 15th floor and I would bring my own sheets!
reviews.title: Hair madness!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from 10th October to 24th October in rooms 407 and 408. It was my first visit to Orlando, and what a rememberable one. Staff in the hotel are fantastic. They always had time to chat, and ask how we were. Alan, Ron and Laressa (night receptionist, sorry if its wrong) were so friendly, and could not do enough for you. We had a lower level floor which looked over the congo river golf, but we did not hear any noise from it. The housekeeper kept the room clean, although when I requested for the sheets to be changed on the bed, it was not done that day, but was the next which was not a problem. The hotel's pool area was nice and tidy, and the bar staff were always polite. We used the free shuttle provided for Disney parks, which was very reliable and quick. Universal studios and Islands of adventure is a nice 20 min stroll away. Walgreens, I-Hop, Dennys, and 7-11 all within the vicinity. Lynx and I-ride stop outside the hotel. We found the Lynx was quicker then the I-ride, and was less crowded. The lifts were out of service on one occasion, but this was due to an emergency, and staff apologised for the inconvenience. As we were only on the 4th floor, taking the stairs was no bother. The lady on the Universal studios desk in reception booked an airboat ride at our request, which was very kind and helpful. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone! Once again, thank you for such an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Clean hotel and pool, friendly staff, convenient location for Universal and I Drive, 7/11 over the road, Ihop next door, Walgreens next block over. Hotel provides free shuttles for Universal Studios and Disney, and there is an I Trolley stop directly outside. We were out doing the theme parks everyday, and found it to be a great base. I've yet to experience a hotel air con unit that isn't a bit noisy, so other than that it was fine.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient for Universal Studios

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 10 nights in October 2011 and is the best hotel we have stayed at in Orlando. Hotel was nice and clean and staff were really friendly and helpful from the front desk to the housekeeping staff (the lady who cleaned our room was always happy and singing). Special mentions to Ron who always had time for a quick chat (and even waved to us from the car park of the 7/11 the day we were leaving - luv ya Ron), and Michelle on the Universal desk. Room was big and clean with views over I Drive and Universal in the distance. Nice big bathroom as well which you don't get in many hotels. Pool area was nice and was never too crowded. Trolley and Lynx stops outside made getting around easy. Have noted other people's comments regarding the lifts not working. This happened a couple of times when we stayed but was not an inconvenience. These things happen - chill out! Had a problem with our safe but this was sorted within 10 - 15 minutes of reporting it. Great service! Free bottles of water every day was a bonus as was the free Internet in the lobby (for us Facebook addicts!)
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend Great Western for buffet breakfast and dinner. Maybe not as plentiful as the Ponderosa but food nice and hot and Diane the server was really friendly and sweet.
reviews.title: great hotel.. great pool.. very comfortable..early check in. great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at other Four Points by Sheraton hotels, and I have to say this one was a bit below the usual standard. I get the feeling that it's a high traffic hotel, and they perhaps can't keep up with the wear and tear. I'd say the official hotel photos flatter the hotel, but the room was comfortable enough, with two double beds and a large bathroom.
reviews.title: Below par for a Four Points by Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: The hotel offers reduced tickets, but on the condition you go on an organised visit to see one of its sister resorts. We weren't interested in doing that, so we opted to buy our day ticket from the Universal Studios rep at the same desk. If you're in a hurry, head straight for Universal Studios rep so you don't have to listen to 10 minutes of impassioned sales chat! The ticket desk also offers discount vouchers for the nearby malls and tickets for the hotel shuttle to Universal Studios.
reviews.title: First Florida trip good starting point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in oct 2011 for two weeks as a family of five, when booking we were assured the rooms were big enough but this wasn't the case felt very confined! Rooms and hotel were extremely clean which was a very positive part of our holiday plenty of towels and hot water, staff where exceptionally helpful and always went out of there way to wish you a good morning and welcome you back they are a great source of advice and helpful tips to get the best from Florida!! On another less positive note, the lifts breakdown a lot, we were stuck in them a lot, and there was a flood that damaged a lot of our personal things although the staff new about the water pouring into our rooms on the 14 floor they had put buckets in to collect this they made no move to contact us or remove our personal pissesions out the way. That was very disappointing and we are still waiting on recompense and contact from the hotel :(:(:(
reviews.title: not a bad hotel but!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: as the title says not a bad hotel but it does have it's problems,you need to use your room keys to use the lift but they frequently fail,the lifts break down on a regular basis and the pool area needs upgrading.on the plus side the hotel is in a convenient location red lobster and 7/11 across the road with an i ride trolley and a bus stop right outside,free coffee in the lobby in the morning and you can buy a basic breakfast in the lobby if you don't want to use the restaurant or go elsewhere the young girl who worked in the lobby in the morning is a lovely girl always polite and pleasant. unfortunately the the thing that really let this hotel down for us and why we will probably not go back is we experienced a theft amounting to around £800 from the safe in our room and i know these items were placed in the safe this spoilt the holiday somewhat so i would just say be very careful with your valuables,as i say this wasn't a bad hotel i have stayed in worse in florida but due to the theft i doubt if we will return to this hotel
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This place has it all. It is clean, Javier the manager is great, Irma from Alamo rental car is the best. If you don't want to rent a car they have shuttle busses that will take you to the parks. The hotel is located between Ihop and Denny's. Also in front you have Red Lobsters and a Minigolf.
reviews.title: Family weekend getaway success

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at this hotel in September. We paid extra for a club room on the top floor. The room was clean, comfortable and well worth the extra. The front of house staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Short Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we enjoyed our stay. The last time we visited Orlando was in November a few years ago. The difference in temperature and humidity was considerable thus making this an altogether stickier visit!
reviews.title: Great location and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The I-Ride and Lynx buses stop just outside the hotel so getting around is easy. Universal is about a 15 minute walk.
reviews.title: decent, clean, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fout Points for 8 nights. Our room was clean and tidy, the aircon was a little noisy but worked well and nothing that earplugs didn't solve. Loads of water and toiletries were provided every day by the efficient housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: not as good as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did have a blocked toilet on the last night which they were unable to solve prior to bedtime. Staff apologised the next morning and offered us free breakfast as compensation.
reviews.title: October 11-15 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location for Universal Studios - we stayed for four nights and went to Universal / Islands of Adventure three days during the stay - we walked there, it's just a 20 minute walk and saves you paying for parking or waiting for the shuttle bus.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: The rooms are a good size, clean with TV, coffee machine, air con etc plus a very comfy bed.
reviews.title: Decent Four Points, but certainly dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a small pool, a games room, a laundrette, plenty of car parking, free newspapers and coffee in the lobby each morning.
reviews.title: Great HOtel
orlando parks visit
reviews.text: Service was really good, I would go down for coffee and papers and there was always someone in the lobby to greet you and he would call the lift and press my floor for me when I wanted to go back up - thoughtful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are plenty of places to eat close by - our firm favourite is sweet tomatoes!
reviews.title: What a Relief

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The first thing i want to say is that this stay renewed my faith in The Sheraton(see my last review on The Sheraton Hotel). If your looking for a great place to stay for a good price this is the place for you. The Four Points by Sheraton was professional, courteous, and pleasent. Upon arriving i was greeted and checked in promptly. This room i stayed in was on the 15th floor and you had to use your room key to access your floor, a very secure feature. The room large enough with two queen size beds, flat screen tv, large bathroom and free wifi service all included. I did not get a chance to check out the pool because it wasnt hot enough during my stay but he resturant was nice and breakfast was included. The hotel staff was very pleasent and attentive to all your needs. They also have car rental services in the hotel as well a big plus. The Four Points is perfectly located, just 15 mins. away from Universal Studios. The only negetive for me was that they didnt provide airport pick up service, but you can take a shuttle service from the airport for about 15 bucks. All in all it was an excellant stay and I would recommend it to anyone that wants to get the most for they're money. Thanks to The Four Points by Sheraton for making me feel right at home.......
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
Great views
reviews.text: This hotel looks like its been recently renovated. The rooms are all view rooms, get the highest floor possible. Plasma TV, big bathroom. Beds were a little hard and worn. Mini golf next door. Nice restaurant on site, also many restaurants next door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in November and it was not such a great stay. This trip, we needed a convenient location and decided to try this hotel again. It was a pleasant surprise. The room we stayed in was a deluxe room and was pretty nice.Comfortable bed and a high floor with a view. The staff were much more friendly. The room was clean, the bathrooms are average but we knew that going in. The stay was great and we used this as a base for traveling for several days. As always, the bartenders are friendly and the food is pretty good from the bar, prices are fair.
reviews.title: Stayed before, this was much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: We arrived here without a reservation but wanted to stay close to attractions for our honeymoon. We wanted to have an adventure so we drove around and found this hotel. It looks interesting from the outside. The check in process was a nightmare. It took an extremely long time and it was very chaotic. We had just two requests a king bed and a fridge. We settled for a queen room with a fridge. The room was so small, we couldn't really walk around and no fridge. We checked out. We weren't interested in switching rooms because of how chaotic it was checking in and we didn't want to wait again. It was not ideal for a honeymoon. We drove around and found a different hotel.
reviews.title: Only stayed for check in and five minutes...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a trip with my wife for the weekend. I would summarize this property as being at the top of lower end hotels.
reviews.title: Middle of the road property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall this is a really nice hotel. Quick check-in, clean room, good views, pretty good breakfasts and a 15-minute walk to Universal Orlando. Lots of good restaurants in Universal City Walk so within walking distance of the hotel. Free wi-fi. The I-Ride Trolley stops right outside and is a cheap and easy way to get to other attractions like Sea World.
reviews.title: Great for Universal
Nice place to stay
reviews.text: Downsides are minor - no fridge in the room, and staff were uneven - some were absolutely lovely and really helpful, others were less so. Also the only mirrors in the room were in the bathroom, which was a very minor annoyance. I'd happily stay again, though, as it's pretty perfect for Universal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our second time we stayed in the Four Points. It is a nice hotel close to a couple of atractions. You can easily walk to Universal City. Going there in the evening for dinner is a good idea. The International Drive and shop are close by. The personal is very friendly. Check in was easy and very friendly. We had a big room on the 17fh floor with a nice view towards the I-Drive. Cleaning rooms is not so good. after late leaving the room in the morning they didn't clean. Beds are excellemt and bathroom is ok. It was too windy to use the pool, looked good. In the morning complementary coffe and tea in the lobby. This is a good hotel in a nice area
reviews.title: It's an average hotel in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel emphasizes meh to me. I think it's easy to be spoiled by SPG hotels (like the W) where you can get truly amazing quality of service, accommodations, and a good experience.
reviews.title: Good hotel and convenient location to Universal Parks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I think this Four Points hotel does a good job of letting you find a place to sleep and the location is good if you are trying to do the tourist-y things in Orlando.
reviews.title: awesome in every things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very accomodating! Room was a little small but cozy and nice. We had a room with 2 queen beds. Loved the location!!! Was able to walk to Universal Studios, I-Drive shops, Outlet Malls, and good shuttle service. Only complaint was that the housekeepers when going in and out of rooms cleaning one day were slamming the doors. I think this happened atleast 5-8 times. It was crazy. But other than that it was very nice! We were on the 20th Floor. The views were pretty good too. Oh yes, the channel changing for the TV was extremely SLOW. We would stay there again!
reviews.title: Saving Grace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Orlando many times over the last 20 years and have always wondered what this hotel was like so on my latest trip I booked it for one night as I couldn't get a room in my hotel of choice.
reviews.title: Glad it was only one night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: I asked for a high room.I was given a room on the 5th floor as I was told they were fully booked. 30 minutes later when I was in the foyer another guest checked in and was given a room on 16th floor.??? I also requested a fridge but was told that they didn't have any available. Anyway later I found out they charge $10 a night for a fridge which I could find any mention of on their site.
reviews.title: Realy good location. And nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I also had to ask later on for a cr parking voucher as I wasn't given one when i checked in.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next to the room, it was clean enough but the bedside light didn't work and the TV remote took an age to change chanels. As I didn't ahve a fridge I thought I would get some ice. The ice machines are not on all floors and the ones on the 4th, 6th and 8th were not working. I had to go to the 10th floor for ice. I should have tried the pool it was freezing....
reviews.title: A Wonderful Time

aka: 4 Points By Sheraton Studio City Hotel
description: Excitement is in the air at the Four Points by Sheraton Orlando Studio City in the heart of Orlando. Located on the world-famous International Drive, just across from Universal Orlando Resort.
